titleStmt.title: Despatch from J. Milton Turner to Frederick W. Seward, October 16, 1877

bibl.title: Despatch from J. Milton Turner to Frederick W. Seward
Despatches from United States Consuls in Monrovia, 1852-1906

div1.p:
Consulate General, United States
Monrovia, Liberia
16th Octo. 1877

J. Milton Turner
To the
Department of State
Washington
Subject: U.S. Commercial Agent at Grand Bassa.
Abstract of contents:

The attention of the Liberia Govt. was called to the appointment of the successor of Mr. Crusoe according to 7th Article of Treaty. Mr. Cheeseman's right to act as such, witheld by the Lib. Govt: and recommending the appointment of H. A. Williams to be successor to Mr. Crusoe.

Consulate General, United States
Monrovia, Liberia
16. Octo. 1877
Sir,

The subject of my No. 31. which relates to the appointment of a gentleman to succeed Mr. Crusoe in the capacity of Commercial Agent at Grand Bassa, Liberia having recurred, I have the honor to state for the information of the Department, that in compliance with the provisions of the 7th Article of our Treaty with Liberia I
Honorable
F. W. Seward
Asst. Secty State,
Washington
I addressed to the Secretary of State a note, copy of which is transmitted herewith, and marked "enclosure No. 1" in which I requested the permission of this Government to be extended to Mr. J. J. Cheeseman to be Acting Commercial Agent of the United States, instead of Mr. Crusoe, resigned. It appears from the reply of Secretary Blacklidge, Copy of which is marked "enclosure No. 2," – that there are on the part of this Government, objections to Mr. Cheeseman's being permitted to act in that capacity. My recognition of those objections may be found by reference to enclosures 3. 5. of this despatch Enclosure No. 7. relates to my tender of the position
position to H. A. Williams, Esqr. a citizen of Grand Bassa, engaged in mercantile business in that County. As soon as Mr. Williams can be heard from, I will, if he accepts the position, ask the permission of this Government to be extended to him to act in that capacity, and report the result to the Department.

I have the honor to be,
Sir,
Your obedient servant
J. Milton Turner

Legation of the United States
Monrovia
28. Sept. 1877
Sir,

I have the honor to inform your Government that Honorable J. L. Crusoe has resigned the position of United States Commercial Agent at Grand Bassa and to request, respectfully, the permission of your Government for Honorable J. J. Cheeseman to act in that position until such time
Honorable
J. W. Blacklidge
Secty of State
Monrovia.
time as my Government may think proper to name Mr. Crusoe's successor

I have the honor to be,
Sir,
With expressions of highest esteem
Your obedient servant
(Sd) J. Milton Turner.

Department of State
Monrovia, 6. Octo. 1877.
Sir,

I have the honor to acknowledge the receipt of your favor of the 28 ultimo, conveying the intelligence to my government of your appointing J. J. Cheeseman of the County of Grand Bassa temporary vice U.S. Consul, vice J. L. Crusoe resigned.

Absence from the City several days is the cause of not replying sooner. I hasten now to do so, advising you that I have the direction
His Excellency
J. Milton Turner
U.S. Minister Resident
Monrovia.
direction of the President to inform you of a circumstance you may not have known or perhaps overlooked viz: the recent election of the Gentleman named for that appointment by you to the Honorable the House of Representatives of the Republic of Liberia: and the recognition of whose appointment would at least, appear incongrous having him acting in a double capacity or in other words, in the interest of each nationality

I have the honor to be,
Your obedient servant
(Sd) J. W. Blacklidge

Legation of the United States
Monrovia 9 Octo. 1877
Sir,

Your despatch of the 6th instant is received. It relates to my application for the permission of your Government to be extended to Honorable J. J. Cheeseman to be Acting Commercial Agent of the United States at Grand Bassa, until such time as my Government can appoint a successor to Honorable H. L. Crusoe, resigned; and points to
Honorable,
J. W. Blacklidge,
Secretary of State
Monrovia
to the reasons influencing the Government of Liberia to withold the permission referred to.

I have the honor to be,
Sir,
Your obedient servant
(Sd) J. Milton Turner
Sir,

I have the honor to acknowledge the receipt of your favor dated October 9th. in answer to my note of the 6th. inst. with reference to the appointment of J. J. Cheeseman as Commercial Agent of the United States

I have the honor to be,
Sir,
Your obedient servant
(Sd) J. W. Blacklidge
div1.fw:
Honorable
J. Milton Turner
U.S. Minister Resident
Monrovia.

div1.p: Sir,

Be pleased to find transmitted herewith a copy of my application to the Government of Liberia requesting permission, as required by a provision of the Treaty of the United States with Liberia, for you to act in the capacity of United States Commercial Agent at Grand Bassa; also a copy of the Secretary of States's reply thereto; in which is pointed out
Honorable
J. Jas. Cheeseman,
Edina,
Grand Bassa.
out the reasons why the necessary permission is withheld from you by the Government of Liberia.
Should you consent to guard the safety of the Archives of the Agency until such time as Mr. Crusoe's successor is designated, I will esteem it an especial consideration.

I am,
Sir,
Very Respectfully
Your obedient servant,
(Sd) J. Milton Turner

Legation of the United States
Monrovia, 9. Octo. 1877.
Sir,

Be pleased to find transmitted herewith a copy of my application to the Government of Liberia requesting permission, as required by a provision of the Treaty of the United States with Liberia, for you to act in the capacity of United States Commercial Agent at Grand Bassa; also a copy of the Secretary of States's reply thereto; in which is pointed out
Honorable
J. Jas. Cheeseman,
Edina,
Grand Bassa.
out the reasons why the necessary permission is withheld from you by the Government of Liberia.
Should you consent to guard the safety of the Archives of the Agency until such time as Mr. Crusoe's successor is designated, I will esteem it an especial consideration.

I am,
Sir,
Very Respectfully
Your obedient servant,
(Sd) J. Milton Turner

U.S. Commercial Agency,
Grand Bassa, Octo. 16. 1877.
Sir,

I have the honor to acknowledge receipt of your dispatches under Sept. 18. & 9th. inst. both of which reached me to day. Copies of your correspondence with the Government of Liberia respecting my appointment as U.S. Com. Agent. I have perused, and the reply of the Honorable Secretary of State, directed to you in which he makes reference to the incongruity of serving in a two fold position I have especially noted. The honorable Secretary was pleased
pleased to remark in his dispatch to you that "The recent election of the gentleman named by you for that appointment to the Honorable the House of Representatives of the Republic of Liberia, would at least appear incongruious having him acting in a double capacity," permit me to remark that my being a member of the Legislature of Liberia lies peculiarly within the knowledge of the Government. And it is indeed very strange that no such notice has come to hand, and consequently I have no authority to say that I am a member of the House of Representatives of the Republic of Liberia.

I
I have the honor to remain
Sir,
Your Obedient Servant,
(Sd) J. Jas. Cheeseman

Legation of the United States
Monrovia, Liberia
16. Octo. 1877.

H. A. Williams
Edina.
Sir,

Should you be willing to accept the position of United States Commercial Agent, Grand Bassa County, hereby tendered to you, be pleased to apply to either Honorable H. L. Crusoe or Honorable J. J. Cheeseman for advices how to make up a Bond for ($2000) Two Thousand Dollars as specified by the United States Consular Regulations and directed by Law to be filed at Washington with the
the United States Treasurer for the safety of the Archives of the Agency &c. and forward same to me by return mail whereupon this paper shall be your sufficient authority for receipting for the Seal and Archives of the United States Commercial Agency at Bassa to Honorable J. J. Cheeseman the Actg. Commercial Agent; and also your authority for entering upon the discharge of the duties of United States Commercial Agent at Bassa until such time as you shall receive Certificate of your appointment by the Government at Washington, or further advices from this Legation.

I
I am,
Sir,
Your obedient servant
(Sd) J. Milton Turner
